text: Frederick Garrity (14 November 1936 â€“ 19 May 2006 ) was an English singer and actor. He was best known as the singer of the English pop group Freddie and the Dreamers from 1959 until 2001. Before being a member of Freddie and the Dreamers, he was a milkman. He was well known in his local neighbourhood when he sang as he was delivering milk. Between 1968 and 1973, Garrity and his former bandmate Pete Birrell (bass guitar) appeared in the ITV children's television program Little Big Time. Garrity retired from touring in 2001 when he became sick. He died in Bangor, Wales on 19 May 2006 aged 69. == References == Category:1936 births Category:2006 deaths Category:English singers Category:Musicians from Manchester
title: Freddie Garrity
